description.narrative: Promotion of Sustainable Return and Reintegration of IDPs and Refugees in Darfur.The Project is a joint programme implemented by UNDP, UNHCR and UNAMID. In addition, the Project is closely coordinated with IOM and WHO

participating-org.narrative: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

provider-org.narrative: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT

description.narrative:
Atlas Activity 1 - JP Output 1: Safety and security is provided at 15 return sites - FaST 9.5 Pillar I; FaST 6.1 Pillar II) 1.1 Number of police stations, police posts and mobile police units constructed and equipped 2.2 Number of police officers trained in areas human rights, investigation techniques, family and child protection, Sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV), and community policing 1.3 % of female police officers and staff increased and trained 1.4 Number of protection incidents addressed 1.5 Number of Community Policing safety centres and Local Safety Working Groups (LSWGs) established 1.6 Number of safety profiles and plans developed in return clusters 1.7 Number of security and UXO assessments conducted 1.8 Extent that security concerns at return sites are factored into the VRRC Returns Strategy.
Atlas Activity 2 - JP Output 5: Livelihoods and income-generation activities are promoted in return areas - FaST 6.8 Pillar II. 5.1 Percentage of households whose livelihood assets have increased in two years from project inception (e.g. livestock, agriculture production) 5.2 Percentage rehabilitated or developed community assets linked with markets and value chains. 5.3 Number of men and women employed in temporary labour intensive schemes 5.4 Number of savings and loans associations formed and active (number of women and men participating) 5.5 Number of CBOS established (CDC, producers group, infrastructure management committee, women’s associations, youth associations) (number of women and men participating). 5.6 Extent that VRRC Returns Strategy promotes livelihoods and income generating activities.
Atlas Activity 3 - JP Output 6: Capacity building for the Government of Sudan in Return, Reintegration and Urbanisation concerns in all 5 states (FaST 6.10 Pillar II) 6.1 Percentage of VRRC and other government staff feel better capacitated and able to perform their duties 6.2 Percentage of RRR Sector members report that sector meetings have been ve

Atlas Activity 2 - JP Output 5: Livelihoods and income-generation activities are promoted in return areas - FaST 6.8 Pillar II. 5.1 20% households with livelihoods assets 5.2 10% community assets linked to markets 5.3 No (0) women employed in labour intensive schemes 5.4 Zero (0) savings and loans associations in place 5.5 One (1) producer group established per village in 2016 5.6 No Strategy in place Atlas Activity 3 - JP Output 6: Capacity building for the Government of Sudan in Return, Reintegration and Urbanisation concerns in all 5 states (FaST 6.10 Pillar II) 6.1 Zero (0) % 6.2 Zero (0) % 6.3 4 established in 2016 6.4 Increased by appox 80%; 6.5 Zero (0); 6.6 Zero (0 in place
N/A. The project has been operationally closed by 31 December 2018 and no activities in 2019.

N/A. The project has been operationally closed by 31 December 2018 and no activities in 2021.

• The Project handed over 2 Community Policing Centres in the Thur and Kormandi villages in Central Darfur State within the reporting period. These centers benefited over 3000 households who have started to witness increased returns due to improved security. According to beneficiary interviews, community security in the two villages have improved due to the permanent presence of police who interface with the community policing committees. • Seven (7) producers’ groups (4 crop production & 3 goat fattening/milk producers) benefiting over 380 farmers (37% women) to improve their livelihoods. Each crop producer household received 27kg of improved vegetable seeds and 5 irrigation system rehabilitated while livestock producer households received 150 goats/sheep and 25.4 MT of Fodder in addition to trainings on production, processing and marketing. • In order to restore confidence, rebuild social fabric between community groups, revive traditional conflict resolution mechanisms and promote inter-communal dialogue among farmers and nomadic communities, five 5 inter-communal peaceful coexistence forums were held in North Darfur. Over 400 people attended comprising of farmers and nomadic leaders, Farm Protection Committees, IDPs, native administrations, civil society organizations (CSOs), local authorities and the State Commissioner for Security and Peace • Durable solutions coordination is crucial and UNDP conducted a capacity assessment of 5 VRRCs and other relevant state and federal stakeholders as well as identify needs and areas to strengthen. The outcomes from the assessment were discussed and agreed with all relevant stakeholders in Government and International Community and included in a broader capacity development plan. Also durable solutions profiling partially supported by this project have been completed in Central and Norther Darfur States. Intervention planning is not on the way.
